result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:47 PM Defendant Henrickus Echols Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Lexi Keyes in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has applied for SPD, but no one is appointed yet.  Case rescheduled.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Henrickus Echols Jr appeared by phone. Defendant advised of right to attorney.  Defendant given information regarding SPD and court appointed attorney.  Case rescheduled.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
from def asking for hearing to be rescheduled or to appear via zoom
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

12:10 PM Defendant appeared.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
IA rescheduled per DA;  DA to mail defendant paperwork
